original:
Wake capture is a phenomenon that enables organisms to recycle energy from the fluid dynamics or vortices generated by their own movement. This process is observed in both aquatic and terrestrial organisms across various sizes. Smaller organisms, in particular, benefit significantly from this dynamic of fluid locomotion, as the effects of fluid interactions are proportionally greater due to their reduced size.

This process is observed in both aquatic and terrestrial organisms across various sizes. Wee organisms, in particular, benefit significantly on this dynamic of fluid locomotion, as the effects of fluid associations are proportionally greater due to their reduced size.
